Start: ^Once the dinner has wound down, I quietly head to my room to rest.
PrimarySuccess: ^For in what feels like an eternity, I feel good going to bed today.

b: ^Timothy walks in and plots down to bed.
^we chat, and he offers to help me pack my bags, which we do.
^I look over at Timothy's vacent bed.
^I feel a little bad I couldn't help him.
^I distract myself by packing my bags.
^No clue if its actually worth it, given I'll just wake up back at the start of the week, but its good to pretend I'm leaving, at least.

PrimarySuccess: ^With that done, I call it a night.
^I sleep more calmly than I've slept in a long while.
SecondarySuccess: ^I saved Timothy, and The time loops should be broken!
^Now, All I've got to do is wait, til tomorrow comes...
^Its a little weird to even imagine tomorrow coming at all.
^I look at my bags, barely packed, because, well why bother. Time Loop and whatnot. but now...
^Now, I should probably be getting ready for tomorrow.
FirstRRR: ^Well, I suppose it’s not going to be my room anymore. Not after today.
^I'm not sure he'll ever return to claim it.
^I look at my bags, half packed with the crap I call my own. Despite all my time here, it's still not much more than I arrived with.
^With a heavy sigh, I look away and toss myself into my sheets. @One of the last things I can call my own in this space.
^I'm alone in a room meant for no one, and nothing is fine.
^I'm leaving tomorrow, and I don't know what to do.
^I start shaking slightly, as tears bubble in my eyes.
^I'm leaving tomorrow, and I don't know what to do.
^I don't want to leave. I've been here too long. I don't know what I'll do when I'm gone.
^But I don't want to stay here, in this vacant room. I don't want to waste away.
^I don't want to leave. @I don't want to stay.
^As I drift off to sleep, all I can think is how badly I want this pain to go away.
^`A Garden for the Mind` according to the brochure the doctors gave me.
^Pretty cheesy, but they said I don't really stand much chance in the real world. Maybe they're right.
^I feel something gnawing at the back of my mind, but I ignore it. I walk up to the building and heave open the large oak doors.
^The gnawing intensifies as I step inside. It's like an itch in my brain.
^Max rounds the corner, all smiles. Wait, Max? How do I know that name?
^[Max?] "Hi! Welcome to Sunflower House! Are you the new resident I'm supposed to be expecting?
^Something feels wrong. My head is pounding now.
^[Max?] "Rad. Name's Max, pronouns are They/Them. Don't worry if you mess it up, I don't bite."
^[Max] "Since your room's here on the first floor, I'll be... your... R.A.
^I nod. I'd rather not make a scene.
^[Max] "Why I don't I go ahead and show you to your room?"
^As Max leads me down the hallway and opens the door to my new room, I feel an overwhelming sense of Deja Vu.
^[Max] "Your quarters, your Majesty. Uh, maybe you should lie down or something."
^[Max] "Okay, then. I've gotta get back to cleaning the cafeteria, so just come and find me whenever you're ready."
^Max departs, leaving me alone in my new room. Why doesn't it feel like the first time I've been in here?
^I look over at the other bed and a shiver crawls up my spine. Inexplicable dread overcomes me.
^The gnawing in my mind transforms into the shock of epiphany as color drains from the world.
^The room falls away into darkness and I am whisked back to Blackwell.
^I can feel the whispers before I hear them. I'm not running this time.
^[Voices] "This is your doing. You weren't there for him."

c: ^] "I tried to be friendly! I'm not responsible for what happened!"
^[Voices] "Idiot! Your selfishness has not even benefited you. Now you have nothing."
^] "It's not my fault! I barely knew him!"
^[Voices] "You're as worthless a liar as you are a person."
^[Voices] "This is why you'll never have any real friends."

g-0: ^The Voices laugh and howl. The walls of Blackwell pulse unnaturally, faster and faster as my heartbeat quickens.
^I try to shout again, but I can't form the words.
^I collapse, clutching my pounding chest as an icy wind whips across my face.
^The cackling Voices fade into a low rumble that begins toppling the walls around me.

RRR: ^I tell myself that, over and over, until I fall asleep.
^<color=A5C5E3FF>Progress Status: ... DETECTING @ Primary Objective: ... FAILURE @ Secondary Objective: ... SUCCESS </color>
